name: ibm_biginsights_quickstart
long_description:
ibm-rightscale Cookbook ======================= TODO: Enter the cookbook description here. e.g. This cookbook makes your favorite breakfast sandwhich. Requirements ------------ TODO: List your cookbook requirements. Be sure to include any requirements this cookbook has on platforms, libraries, other cookbooks, packages, operating systems, etc. e.g. #### packages - `toaster` - ibm-rightscale needs toaster to brown your bagel. Attributes ---------- TODO: List you cookbook attributes here. e.g. #### ibm-rightscale::default
Key Type Description Default
['ibm-rightscale']['bacon'] Boolean whether to include bacon true
Usage ----- #### ibm-rightscale::default TODO: Write usage instructions for each cookbook. e.g. Just include `ibm-rightscale` in your node's `run_list`: ```json { "name":"my_node", "run_list": [ "recipe[ibm-rightscale]" ] } ``` Contributing ------------ TODO: (optional) If this is a public cookbook, detail the process for contributing. If this is a private cookbook, remove this section. e.g. 1. Fork the repository on Github 2. Create a named feature branch (like `add_component_x`) 3. Write you change 4. Write tests for your change (if applicable) 5. Run the tests, ensuring they all pass 6. Submit a Pull Request using Github License and Authors ------------------- Authors: TODO: List authors

biginsights/console/use_ssl.description: Should https be configured for the web console?.

biginsights/hadoop_distribution.description: Hadoop distribution name for Big Insights.

biginsights/data_node_unique_hostnames.description: Hostnames for the Big Insights data nodes.
